data.title: FontDescription / IntermediateSerializer compatibility
data.body: Caught another cause that needed to be changed (in the same way as before) to correctly deserialize char types.

data.title: Minor IntermediateSerializer fixes.
data.body:
IntermediateSerializer now properly reads nullable types which have a non-null value.
ElementSerializer<T> now properly deserializes char type properties, including values that would normally be considered delimiters.

data.title: Reduce allocations in GraphicsDevice.PlatformApplyRenderTargets()
data.body:
Specialized the ArrayEqualityComparer to avoid allocations in EqualityComparer<T>.Equals(). GetHashCode() is also slightly faster.
Those methods are called each time GraphicsDevice.glFramebuffer.TryGetValue() is called in PlatformApplyRenderTargets() meaning it is called each frame and can result in quite a bit of memory allocations.

data.title: Bgra5551
data.body:
Add the struct `Bgra5551`.

 http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.packedvector.bgra5551.aspx

Extend the current `PackedVectorTest`s to ensure compatibility with XNA:

 https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/Test/Framework/PackedVectorTest.cs

data.title: Misc model pipeline fixes
data.body: These are some cherry-picked refinements from a branch I was working out of this past summer. They fix some inconsistencies with XNA and some bad keyframe extraction I was doing at the import stage.

data.title: Fixed Song.PlayPosition on Android
data.body:
Fixed Song.PlayPosition that is invalid on Android after a Play-Pause cycle.
The fix was proposed by @dellis1972 here:
https://bugzilla.xamarin.com/show_bug.cgi?id=23171

data.title: Fix for ResolveRelativePath stripping drive char
data.body:
As per issues #3064 and #3041, parsing a file path through the
ResolveRelativePath function was stripping out the drive letter. This
crash was especially prominent for the sound and video loaders.

This fix will strip out the platform-specific path separation character
if it exists and will not try to remove it if it doesn't.

Windows 8-specific considerations were also taken into account.

data.title: Vector classes are not serializable
data.body: Please mark the Vector2|3|4, Point and the Rectangle class as serializable like XNA did it.

data.title: Fixed GamePadDPad Construction
data.body:
This PR fixes the constructor for `GamePadState` to properly set the `GamePadDPad` button state.

Fixes #3070.

data.title: GamePadState constructor with Buttons array not constructing GamePadDPad correctly
Fix ReleaseAllTouchesTest
data.body: Refs #3052

data.title: Fixed ModelProcessor.DefaultEffect
data.body:
This PR adds support for `ModelProcessor.DefaultEffect` and adds a few exceptions to match XNA behavior.

Fixes https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3057.

data.title: Fixed storage container creating existing directory
data.body:
Made the storage container code check if the directory exists before
creating a new one over the top.

The previous behaviour was causing a crash on software created using the
PSM build (and perhaps others) of MonoGame.

Refer to issue [**#3061**](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/3061) for more information.

data.title: Updated Vector2
data.body: Changes : All things inside Vector2 now commented, added missed methods from XNA.

data.title: Improvements for Vector2
data.body: Changes : Vector2 now fully commented + added missed methods from XNA

data.title: FileHelper class bug in locating file
data.body:
Hi,

we are now moving all our projects to MG 3.2. We are currently working with the /develop branch. 

We would like to actively contribute to the MG project since we are using it from its early stage and we are very skilled on Xamarin over iOS and Android :) We were used to work on a "modifed by us" version of MG 2.5 which had applied some fixes made by us. We got several products on the store published thanks to MG. Ok enough with chatting.

We are in the middle of making some tests to understand where the MG 3.2 "fails" to operate on features we were used to see working on the older version.

The first issue is related to loading musics and videos. This feature it seems not to work properly on windows/iOS and maybe android. The issue is related to this line of code in the FileHelper.cs

```
        // The uri now contains the path to the relativeFile with relative addresses resolved
        // Get the local path and skip the first character (the path separator)
        return NormalizeFilePathSeparators(dst.LocalPath.Substring(1));
```

Is the Substring(1) really necessary? If I change it to Substring(0) all works fine!
In windows the value for dst.LocalPath is something like "C:/../../Content\mycontentfile.xnb". When Substring(1) takes place the path become ":/../../Content\mycontentfile.xnb" which is invalid. Same thing for iOS except there's no "C:\" but only "/User/../../"

data.title: Improvements for Vector2.
data.body: Changes : All things inside Vector2 now commented + ToPoint conversion method

data.title: Updates, extensions and comments for Vector2,Color,Point and Rectangle
data.body:
Changes :

Vector2 :
    -now fully commented,
    -all things sorted within the regions,
    -added ToPoint method,
    -added missed overloads from XNA, for Transform and TransformNormal

Color:
    -some comments changed,
    -all things sorted within the regions,
    -added Invert static method,
    -increase performance for == and != operators,
    -some cleanup   

Point:
    -some comments changed,
    -increase performance for all operators

Rectangle:
    -few comments changed,
    -ToVector4 added

data.title: Fix for PSM CreateDirectory IOException flag of 50 in StorageContainer.cs
data.body:
In the file **StorageContainer.cs** the function **CreateDirectoryAbsolute** was crashing on the **PSM** branch of the project.

The fix was as simple as wrapping the **Directory.CreateDirectory(path);** call with an if block to test if the directory already exists.

_Line 198:_
**Directory.CreateDirectory(path);**

_Becomes:_
**if (!Directory.Exists(path))
{
    Directory.CreateDirectory(path);
}**

Of course, indent it correctly, Markdown doesn't seem to like me.

This _Exists_ protection may also be needed for some of the other functions in this file and elsewhere in _MonoGame_.

data.title: Missing GraphicsAdapter.QueryBackBufferFormat
data.body: [GraphicsAdapater.QueryBackBufferFormat](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.graphics.graphicsadapter.querybackbufferformat.aspx)

data.title: GameUpdateRequiredException in incorrect namespace
data.body:
For reference: [GameUpdateRequired](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.gamerservices.gameupdaterequiredexception.aspx) @ msdn.

Is currently defined in Microsoft.Xna.Framework
Should be defined in Microsoft.Xna.Framework.GamerServices

I was not sure if this was intentional do to GamerServices itself not being implemented, but it appears accidental. Here is the [original commit](https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/commit/1ef87a0a7278b618e96e988a9dcd527f8481c880), which defined all other types in the correct xna namespaces.

data.title: Added code to find all bones in a skeleton not just ones connected to th...
data.body: ...e vertices. This enables helper bones to survive the content processor

data.title: Content Pipeline is not setting the correct Effect for SkinnedModels
SoundBank does not support Interactive Variation Playlist
data.body: Calling PlayCue or GetCue on SoundBank results in a NotSupportedException if the SoundBank contains a Cue with Variation Playlist set to Interactive.

data.title: Separate MonoGame.Net Repository
data.body:
This is a follow-up to #2514, #438, and the following article by Simon Jackson:

http://darkgenesis.zenithmoon.com/monogame-modularisation/

FNA's repository has now been reorganized... (EDIT)

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/FNA

... so I'm now more interested in figuring out a dedicated repository for the now separate MonoGame.Framework.Net.dll project.

I've put all of the GamerServices/Net code from FNA into this repo, for convenience:

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame.Net

As far as I remember there have been no actual code changes in these folders except to add stub methods. Any platform-specific files were based on the Linux files, since most of the desktop platforms were using the same implementation anyway (that is, all stub methods). The full log for both folders is here (the only changes made have been by me):

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/commits/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/GamerServices
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/commits/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Net

The current setup MonoGame has for generating the projects would be the same as it is now, except I will also be providing an FNA configuration as well. The goal is to have everyone using the same networking code that functions across all XNA implementations (including Microsoft XNA4), both to reduce duplicated effort and simplify cross-platform networking (particularly if you plan to roll your own proprietary implementation of these namespaces; Steamworks versions based on the MonoGame GamerServices/Net code are a common example).

How the separate repository is integrated into the main MonoGame repository, and how the migration will play out, I will of course leave to the MonoGame team. Once the repo is ready (however it is made ready), I'll submit the FNA configuration ASAP.

data.title: Fix Texture2D.GetData() on GLES platforms
data.body:
Fix and Simplified Texture2D.GetData()
Works on both iOS and Android (Tested on iPad Mini 1st Gen, iPhone 6, Nexus 7 1st Gen and Nexus 5)
Removed superfluous large memory allocations

WARNING: Only renderable surface formats are supported. The previous code looked like it supported GetData on DXT texture but it will fail since opengl doesn't support attaching a compressed texture to a FBO.

data.title: Updated Rectangle and Point
data.body:
Changes:
Fully documented Rectangle, few fixes for Point.(just for unification),some parameters renamed for compatibility with XNA. New overloads for Offset(because Contains already has few related overloads), new property Size(alias for width and height). All things inside Rectangle now sorted within regions. 
Goodluck MonoGame !

data.title: Enabling Unit Tests
data.body:
This PR enables unit tests in the build script (only Windows DX for now) and makes the build fail if the tests fail.

I had to set a few non-working tests to `[Ignore]` for now.  We should follow up with PRs fixing these.

data.title: Fix GraphicsDevice.Present() not called on iOS
data.body:
While investigating increased memory warnings on our iOS production build since integrating latest MonoGame stuff, we realized that GraphicsDevice.Present is not called on that platform. GraphicsDevice.Present takes care of disposing all graphics resources that where queued for disposal (if GraphicsResource.Dispose() is called from a non-ui thread) and not calling it can result in pretty significant memory leaks in certain scenarios.

This is the simplest fix we can do for now (Android already calls GraphicsDevice.Present in AndroidGamePlatform.Present) until the Present behavior is revamped.

data.title: Fixed a bug in he MGCB intermediate output folder calculation
